stories.title: How to read books by treating them as small bets
Apple and Google ordered by Russia to take down app of Putin's biggest opponent

stories.text:
I lead product at Ubiq and we’re looking for beta testers to participate in our upcoming beta period in mid-September and we’ll hook you up with a $500 Amazon gift card!

If you’re not familiar with Ubiq, we’re a developer-first encryption-as-a-service platform, that enables developers to build client-side encryption directly into their applications, so they can keep their sensitive application data safe from hackers and insider threats! The platform is entirely API-based, doesn’t access any of your data, and handles the complexities of encryption key management and key storage. All you need to do is integrate a software client library and add a few lines of code!

So, here’s the deal. We’re about to release two new features: Format Preserving and Embedded Format Preserving Encryption (FPE/eFPE) for applications written in C, Java and .NET. And we’re looking for beta testers to kick the tires on it and provide us their unfiltered feedback.

Skills you’ll need to bring to the table: -Proficiency in one or more of the following languages: C, Java and .NET -Better-than-average understanding of encryption concepts -Mid-level development skills in the implementation language for library usage -Basic Regex

What we’d expect of you: -Time commitment: a max of 2 hours a week over a 4-week cycle -Complete short weekly surveys -Active development and use of FPE functionality for an existing application e.g., regular encrypts/decrypts throughout the 4-week cycle

What you can expect of us (rewards!): -Every tester that successfully completes the beta testing cycle will receive a $500 USD Amazon gift card. FYSA we can only issues gift cards in the USA, Canada, Hong Kong, and Japan -Additional vouchers and prizes (up to $1,000 USD in Amazon gift cards) will be awarded to testers that go “above and beyond” the standard tester participation requirements.

If you’re interested, please drop us a note at beta@ubiqsecurity.com with the subject line, “I’m interested in the upcoming beta”, and we’ll get you added to the list and then send out a short pre-beta survey!

Thanks a lot!

Wias

P.S. If you’re wondering what the heck Format Preserving Encryption is, we got your back: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Format-preserving_encryption
